title: Temsamani Logotype
content:
I've been wracking my brain checking all of the big foundries trying to ID this font. I uploaded the image to 'WhatTheFont' and posted to the WTF Forum without any luck. The Temsamani site appears to be from Vienna, Austria so I have a gut feeling the font may be from a foundry in Europe.

Any help with an ID very appreciated.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829115934im_/http:/typophile.com/files/temsanami_4259.jpeg)
author: CreativeNRG

comments.content: If you do find it please tell us. I love that R.
Reminds me a bit of Emigre style, but can't quite pin it. I swear I just saw something very similar to this.

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829115934im_/http:/typophile.com/files/TEMS_4567.gif)

It's fairly similar to my own [Houschka Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829115934/http:/www.type.co.uk/a_to_z_listing/id/32553) Bold and DemiBold with some characters from style set 2 and a bit of tweaking.

Nick Cooke

Thanks so much Nick... You nailed it!

I searched through the G-Type collection and felt Houschka was close but mistakenly thought the A, M, N and R in the logotype were standard characters. I've learned a good lesson today. With all the extra glyphs in the Pro versions (Houschka Pro has 853 - Wow!) it certainly makes font ID of logotypes a bit tricky when designers replace standard characters with a glyph or slightly modify others.

Keep up the great work.

Thanks Jeff.

But I didn't think I had nailed it - I just thought it was similar(ish).

Nick Cooke
Bah. See I knew in the back of my head somewhere distant I recognized that R. And I think your R, Nick, is a better solution.
Probably was a modification of it. Good find, Nick.

It wasn't that difficult to find - it was right there in my head all along.

Nick Cooke

I found a little better version of the typeface and must agree with Nick that this doesn't appear to be 'Houschka Pro'. They use this all over their website and I have a hard time believing they customized an entire font.

I'm continuing my quest to ID this typeface and will keep you posted.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829115934im_/http:/typophile.com/files/TC-Logo_6489.gif)

The mystery has been solved after an email to the company. They sent my message to the designer who was kind enough to send the following feedback.

---------- snip ------------  
We are very happy to learn that you like the typeface of our client's logo. Unfortunately the typeface which you are interested in is currently not available, as it is a corporate typeface created for the branding of Temsamani Couture. But the typeface might get released through [http://www.ydt-fonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829115934/http:/www.ydt-fonts.com/ "http://www.ydt-fonts.com") in the near future.

All the best,  
Yvonne Diedrich  
---------- snip ------------

After some research I discovered Yvonne also designed:

– [Eplica](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829115934/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/eplica/overview.html) (Published by Letraset in 2001. It was among the winners of the ( [2001 Type Directors Club Type Design Competition](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829115934/http:/www.tdc.org/news/2001Results/Eplica.html))

– ITC Dyadis (Published by ITC and Linotype in 1998)

I love the R too. My friend E_R_IN will love it!

BTW... Eplica is one of the best values in type, it’s very high on my list.
